description: In ancient Greece the chief magistrate in various Greek city-states was called eponymous archon (ἐπώνυμος ἄρχων, epōnymos archōn). "Archon" (ἄρχων, pl. ἄρχοντες, archontes) means "ruler" or "lord", frequently used as the title of a specific public office,while "eponymous" means that he gave his name to the year in which he held office, much like the Roman dating by consular years.
requirementsTooltip: Unlocked in Town Phase after choosing the hero Aristides.
tooltip: Retraining Aristides costs no Glory and he gives a free trickle of Glory while he lives.
